preprocessing package¶

Submodules¶

preprocessing.Cleaner module¶

The Cleaner module cleans the data by:

  • Taking CSV files with stage/phase information and filtering them, leaving date, time, result and phase fields.
  • Taking individual files for stages (with data/time and result) and merging into a single file.
  • Removing duplicates from the files merged.
preprocessing.Cleaner.clean()¶

Run data cleaning processes.

preprocessing.Cleaner.combine_phase_data()¶

Combine data from processed/filtered data to a single file.

preprocessing.Cleaner.filter_phase_data()¶

Filter phase data for files in raw data folder to ensure only desired fields are taken.

preprocessing.Cleaner.remove_duplicates_phase_data()¶

Remove duplicates from the file (i.e. ensuring only one record per second).

preprocessing.Extractor module¶

The Extractor module extracts the data by:

  • Processing a traffic simulator file in the expected CSV format.
  • Outputting results for a phase state (i.e. red = 0, red/amber = 1, amber = 2 or green = 3) using aspect I/O data.
  • Extracting the relevant detection data and saving it to a separate CSV file.
preprocessing.Extractor.create_aspect_df(stage, df)¶

Create initial data frame for a given stage using aspect I/O data.

Parameters:
  • stage (string) – Name of stage
  • df (dataframe) – CSV-formatted data with I/O aspect states
Returns:

Data frame for grouped aspect I/O data
Return type:

dataframe
preprocessing.Extractor.extract(raw_data, cfg_file)¶

Run data extract method.

Parameters:
  • raw_data (dataframe) – CSV-formatted raw data
  • cfg_file (string) – location of the configuration file
preprocessing.Extractor.extract_io_data(detector_fields, df)¶

Extract detection I/O data from a given data frame using pre-defined detector names.

Parameters:
  • detector_fields (list[str]) – list containing strings associated to the names of each detector
  • df (dataframe) – CSV-formatted data with I/O states
preprocessing.Extractor.extract_phase_data(stage_list, df)¶

Extract stage data using stage list and given data frame.

Parameters:
  • stage_list (list[str]) – list of stage names (e.g. [‘A’, ‘B’])
  • df (dataframe) – CSV-formatted data
preprocessing.Extractor.process_aspect_df(stage, df)¶

Process aspect I/O data to infer red, red/amber, amber or green phase for a given stage

Parameters:
  • stage (string) – Name of stage
  • df (dataframe) – CSV-formatted data with grouped aspect I/O data
preprocessing.Extractor.remove_sup_values(raw_data)¶

Ensure non-relevant (SUP) dummy values, which are generated on system startup, are removed.

Parameters:raw_data (dataframe) – raw CSV data
Returns:raw data excluding SUP values
Return type:dataframe

preprocessing.Main module¶

The Main module is responsible for running methods:

  • To extract data from a given CSV file with historic traffic information.
  • Clean data as part of pre-processing for machine learning.
  • Merge data into a single file for manipulation.
  • Adapt to be used with the scikit-learn framework.

preprocessing.Merger module¶

The Merger class combines the data by merging all phase data and I/O detection data into a single data set CSV file.

preprocessing.Merger.data_merge(detector_fields)¶

Combine all processed data into a single dataset file.

Parameters:detector_fields (list[str]) – list of strings with detector names
Returns:location of dataset
Return type:string

preprocessing.SkLearnProcessor module¶

The ExtractSkLearn module prepares the data for scikit-learn by:

  • Creating a CSV file with phase, result, duration until change of each state.
  • Ensuring the data is suitable for sklearn (e.g. phase types are represented numerically).
preprocessing.SkLearnProcessor.sklearn_data_processing_with_duration(merged_data)¶

Process data for scikit-learn with duration information.

Parameters:merged_data (string) – location of CSV-formatted dataset
preprocessing.SkLearnProcessor.sklearn_data_processing_with_io(merged_data)¶

Process data for scikit-learn taking I/O inputs.

Parameters:merged_data (string) – location of CSV-formatted dataset
preprocessing.SkLearnProcessor.sklearn_data_processing_without_io(merged_data)¶

Process data for scikit-learn without i/o

Parameters:merged_data (string) – location of CSV-formatted dataset
